DataElement.preferredName: Electrocardiography Diagnostic Procedure Corrected QT Interval Calculation Documented
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the documented source of calculating the interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle from electrocardiography (a procedure which records the electrical current in the heart in the form of a continuous strip graph).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Electrocardiography Diagnostic Procedure Corrected QT Interval Calculation Documented
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the documented source of calculating the interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle from electrocardiography (a procedure which records the electrical current in the heart in the form of a continuous strip graph).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: No value exists.:Methods, procedures, and tests performed to diagnose disease, disordered function, or disability.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that displays the electrical activity of the heart.
Any procedure or test to diagnose a disease or disorder.

Property.preferredDefinition: The time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle as corrected with a non-specified correction formula.:The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.:Furnished with or supported by documents and documentation.

Concepts.definition: The time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle as corrected with a non-specified correction formula.
The procedure or activity of determining something by mathematical or logical methods.
Furnished with or supported by documents and documentation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The type of mathematical procedure used in detemining the time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave in the cardiac cycle as corrected with a non-specified correction formula.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A formula which takes into account the physiologic shortening of the QT interval which occurs as the heart rate increases, permitting comparison of the QT interval across a range of rates. It is mathematically defined as: QTcF = QT/CubeRootRR(seconds) and theoretically corrects the QT interval to that which would be observed at a heart rate of 1 cycle per second.

Concepts.definition: A formula which takes into account the physiologic shortening of the QT interval which occurs as the heart rate increases, permitting comparison of the QT interval across a range of rates. It is mathematically defined as: QTcF = QT/CubeRootRR(seconds) and theoretically corrects the QT interval to that which would be observed at a heart rate of 1 cycle per second.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A formula which takes into account the physiologic shortening of the QT interval which occurs as the heart rate increases, permitting comparison of the QT interval across a range of rates. It is mathematically defined as: QTcB = QT/SqRootRR(seconds) and theoretically corrects the QT interval to that which would be observed at a heart rate of 1 cycle per second.

Concepts.definition: A formula which takes into account the physiologic shortening of the QT interval which occurs as the heart rate increases, permitting comparison of the QT interval across a range of rates. It is mathematically defined as: QTcB = QT/SqRootRR(seconds) and theoretically corrects the QT interval to that which would be observed at a heart rate of 1 cycle per second.
